drupalNodeEvent.title: What Will the Trade War Mean for Class Politics?

field_speakers.processed: Yige Dong (SUNY Buffalo), Isabella Weber (UMass Amherst), Jake Werner (Boston University), Moderated by Gustavo Oliveira (UC Irvine)

field_description.processed:
This is the second in a two-part series on the US Elections and the Future of the Trade War. In this webinar, panelists will turn their attention to the consequences and potential implications of the ongoing trade war on the workers who have been caught at its center. How might the November elections affect the future of Chinese and American workers and farmers, and what will American foreign policy decisions mean for labor standards, human rights, and transnational class solidarity?
The first webinar in this series, "Integration or Decoupling: What Lies Ahead?", will take place on November 12. Please register separately for both events.
